result.title: PastScent Network
result.description: A social network for scholars in any discipline working on smell in the past This will include a discussion board on the Odeuropa website a mailing list an actively updated bibliography and resource page linking to relevant projects and initiatives The network will be informed by an advisory board T53

result.title: Annotated image data version 1
result.description: We deliver annotations on D2.1 in two steps: manually annotated data on a test set of 5k-7k images. And after finishing D2.3 annotations with support by the machine. Annotations not only enrich GLAM data (T7.3) but serve as vital ground truth for machine learning.

result.title: Academic conference on olfactory history and digital heritage
result.description: A two-day academic conference on smell in cultural heritage. The key question for this conference will be ‘how can we use and improve the availability of digital heritage data to trace past sensory experiences across Europe?’ Recorded talks will be published on the project website (T5.6) and its papers submitted for review to a special issue in an open-access journal (T5.7).

result.title: Object detection/ image analysis
result.description: We deliver an object recognition and detection AI model which identifies odour-active objects and gestures in art works and co-occurrences via computer vision and D2.2 as training data. We interpret these results critically and in their historical context.

result.title: Methods and tools for knowledge graph link prediction and clustering
result.description: Describe methods and tools to perform link prediction in order to complete a knowledge graph, and clustering to infer similarities between intangible items (T4.3).

result.title: Annotated image data version 2
result.description: We deliver annotations on D2.1 in two steps: manually annotated data on a test set of 5k-7k images. And after finishing D2.3 annotations with support by the machine. Annotations not only enrich GLAM data (T7.3) but serve as vital ground truth for machine learning.
